events.name: üöó Google Cloud Summit in Munich
events.description:
Our GDG Cloud chapter is visiting this time the Google Cloud Summit in Munich! The summit is a full-day event that starts at 08:00 (registration) and lasts until 17:30 o'clock. The event is FREE to attend, but you need to register yourself and get a confirmation from Google.

Summit's homepage in English:
https://inthecloud.withgoogle.com/summit-mun-19-en/home.html
and in German:
https://inthecloud.withgoogle.com/summit-mun-19/home.html

On the summit's homepage you will find the registration link. Using this link register yourself for the summit.

IMPORTANT! To increase your chances to get selected use your BUSINESS/WORK CREDENTIALS, like company email address etc. If everything goes well, then soon you'll receive an email with the subject "[It‚Äôs official] You‚Äôre going to Google Cloud Summit in Munich". Congratulations! This is your official invitation to the summit!

Check out the full agenda of the summit here: https://inthecloud.withgoogle.com/summit-mun-19-en/agenda.html

Members and guests of the GDG Cloud Nuremberg group can gather and drive in groups by cars or by train to Munich! Use the discussion section below to arrange and group yourself with other members.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam "Baseline: Deploy & Develop"
events.description:
Cloud Study Jam is a hands-on workshop that will take place on 30 September 2019 (Monday) at 18:00 in Nuremberg, Germany. At the jam the participants can learn the basics of the cloud computing using the Google Cloud Platform (GCP). Our ambitious goal is to complete the "Baseline: Deploy & Develop" quest (https://www.qwiklabs.com/quests/37), which consists of 12 hands-on labs, using the QwikLabs learning platform. During the workshop we'll try to complete the first 6 labs of the quest and the last 6 labs can be completed by every participant on their own after the workshop at home.

All workshop participants will be provided with one FREE month of full access to the QwikLabs learning platform, where also many other labs are available. Upon the successful completion of the "Baseline: Deploy & Develop" quest you will earn a BADGE and one more FREE month of access to QwikLabs will be enabled.

If you are completely new to the Cloud Study Jams and missed the initial meetup in August 2019, don't worry! Come by and start with a simpler quest, called "GCP Essentials" (https://www.qwiklabs.com/quests/23)! If you are a PRO and our basic labs are peanuts for you, don't worry either! Come by and choose any other QwikLabs quest to solve! You'll still get your FREE access to QwikLabs!

Instruction languages: English or German.

What to bring with you? Bring your LAPTOP together with a POWER SUPPLY!

Agenda:
18:00 Welcome & introduction round
18:10 Initial networking & socializing
18:30 Lab 1: "Google Cloud SDK: Qwik Start - Redhat/Centos" (30 minutes)
19:00 Lab 2: "App Engine: Qwik Start - Python / Go / Java / PHP / Ruby" (20 minutes)
19:20 Lab 3: "Cloud Source Repositories: Qwik Start" (30 minutes)
19:50 Break & Networking
20:10 Lab 4: "Container-Optimized OS: Qwik Start" (30 minutes)
20:40 Lab 5: "Datastore: Qwik Start" (30 minutes)
21:10 Lab 6: "Cloud SQL for MySQL/PostgreSQL: Qwik Start" (30 minutes)
21:40 Next Steps & Thank Yous!
22:00 End of the event

This is a completely FREE event. The drinks and snacks will be on us. The good mood and curious mind on you üòä

Check out the impressions of the last Cloud Study Jam in August 2019: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c0rDFR0vO-Q

Join our Slack workspace: http://bit.ly/GCDGNbgSlack

Follow us on Social Media üëç:
Twitter: https://twitter.com/GDGCloudNbg
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/gdgcloudnuremberg/
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/gdgcloudnuremberg/
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/gdg-cloud-nuremberg
YouTube: http://bit.ly/GDGCloudNbgYT

We'll take pictures and videos during our events, which can be later published. If you don't want to be filmed/photographed make sure to tell it to the organizers on site at the event's beginning.

Use the discussion section below to arrange and group yourself with other members.

events.name: ü§ù Joint Meetup: How to Host WordPress on Google Cloud
events.description:
Dear Cloud enthusiasts!

This time we are organizing a joint meetup with the WordPress Nuremberg user group (https://www.meetup.com/Nurnberg-WordPress-Meetup/). WordPress is THE most popular content management system (CMS) on the Internet. The meetup will be held as a workshop, where each participant can learn how to install and run a WordPress instance in a cloud environment. In addition, we'll discuss such topics as scalability, load balancing, regional availability, etc.

Agenda:
19:00 Welcome & introduction round
19:20 Lab 1: "A Tour of Qwiklabs and the Google Cloud Platform" (40 minutes)
20:00 Break
20:20 Lab 2: "Running WordPress on App Engine Flexible Environment" (40 minutes)
21:00 Discussions & Networking
22:00 End of the event

Both labs will be conducted by our trainer using the Qwiklabs (https://google.qwiklabs.com/) learning platform. Every single step will be clearly explained and if necessary discussed. WordPress will be installed in a real Google Cloud environment (no simulation).

EACH PARTICIPANT has the opportunity to bring along his own laptop and carry out both labs on site! Anyone who chooses to do so, will get 1 month FREE access to the Qwiklabs learning platform ($55 value), where you can solve many more labs and quests and by doing so unlock a 2nd free month of Qwiklabs access.

The event will take place as part of the Cloud Study Jam campaign - a series of hands-on workshops on various Google Cloud technologies. The workshop requires no prior knowledge, all steps will be explained in a simple and understandable way.

This is a completely FREE event. The drinks and snacks will be on us. The good mood and curious mind on you üòä

This event is cross-posted in the WordPress usergroup here: https://www.meetup.com/Nurnberg-WordPress-Meetup/events/256604764/ Feel free to RSVP your attendance with both groups: with our group here and with the WordPress usergroup.

Check out the impressions of our Cloud Study Jam in September 2019: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s2dCt34vmgs

IF YOU CAN'T ATTEND THE MEETUP IN PERSON, no worries! We'll broadcast the instructions in our Slack channel #cloudstudyjams on the same day! Make sure to join our Slack workspace using the following link: http://bit.ly/GCDGNbgSlack

Feel free to follow us on Social Media üëç:
Twitter: https://twitter.com/GDGCloudNbg
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/gdgcloudnuremberg/
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/gdgcloudnuremberg/
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/gdg-cloud-nuremberg
YouTube: http://bit.ly/GDGCloudNbgYT

We'll take pictures and videos during our events, which can be later published. If you don't want to be filmed/photographed make sure to tell it to the organizers on site before the event's beginning.

events.name: FREE Self-paced Workshop "Data, Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence"
events.description:
The meetup on the November 7th 2019 will consist of 2 parts:

PART #1: our distinguished member Choya Chang will demo a chapter of the book "Hands-On Machine Learning with Scikit-Learn and TensorFlow" using Jupyter notebook (30 mins).

PART #2: the rest of the time we'll use to solve as many labs as we can from the Qwiklabs introductory quest "Baseline: Data, ML, AI" (https://google.qwiklabs.com/quests/34). This is a self-paced hands-on workshop intended for beginners, where you'll need a laptop with a modern browser.

All workshop participants will be provided with one FREE month of full access to the QwikLabs learning platform, where also many other labs are available. Upon the successful completion of the "Baseline: Data, ML, AI" quest you will earn a BADGE and one more FREE month of access to QwikLabs will be enabled.

If you are completely new to this kind of self-paced workshops, also called Cloud Study Jams, and missed the previous meetups, don't worry! Come by and start with a simpler quest, called "GCP Essentials" (https://www.qwiklabs.com/quests/23)! If you are a PRO and our basic labs are peanuts for you, don't worry either! Come by and choose any other QwikLabs quest to solve! You'll still get your FREE access to QwikLabs!

Instruction languages: English or German.

What to bring with you? Bring your LAPTOP together with a POWER SUPPLY!

This is a completely FREE event. The drinks and snacks will be on us. The good mood and curious mind on you üòä

events.name: DevFest Nuremberg 2019
events.description:
The FIRST DevFest conference in Nuremberg!

Registration is now OPEN! Proceed to the URL and get your FREE ticket: https://www.eventbrite.de/e/devfest-nuremberg-2019-tickets-73078117617 Additionally, you can RSVP your participation in this meetup entry, but make sure to get your ticket with Eventbrite!

DevFest Nuremberg 2019 is a joint effort of 3 regional GDGs (GDG Nuremberg Android, GDG Erlangen-N√ºrnberg, GDG Cloud Nuremberg) and will provide a lot of interesting speeches and 3 technology tracks (Web, Mobile, Cloud)!

Agenda:

[08:00 - 09:00] Registration & Networking
[09:00 - 09:15] Welcome - DevFest Opening
[09:15 - 09:45] Tarik Huber: "How JavaScript influenced our modern life"
[09:45 - 10:30] Pascal Welsch: "Understanding Declarative UIs - Why we should use Jetpack Compose, Swift UI and Flutter"
[10:30 - 11:00] Coffee Break
[11:00 - 11:30] Martina Kraus: "Boost your ng app: How to increase performance of your Angular App with the help of WebAssembly"
[11:30 - 12:30] Gautier Mechling: "Getting started with microcontrollers and Google Cloud IoT Core"
[12:30 - 13:30] LUNCH
[13:30 - 14:30 parallel] Bilal √áƒ±narlƒ±: "Why Performance Matters?"
[13:30 - 14:30 parallel] Workshop: Flutter
[13:30 - 14:30 parallel] Workshop: Kotlin
[13:30 - 14:30 parallel] Workshop: Cloud
[14:30 - 15:15] Jossi Wolf: "Transforming a Java Desktop Application to Kotlin Mutliplatform"
[15:15 - 15:30] Coffee Break
[15:30 - 16:15] Oluwasegun Famisa: "Light or dark? Leveraging themes and styles to implement dark mode on Android"
[16:15 - 16:45] Nora Schille: "Getting Ready with GraphQL and AWS AppSync"
[16:45 - 17:00] DevFest Closing

Check out the DevFest homepage: https://devfestnuremberg.com/

The DevFest is cross posted in the following groups:
https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Nuremberg-Android/events/xsfbcpyzqbgb/

events.name: Flutter Interact: Viewing Party
events.description:
Google is holding a global party for Flutter aimed at announcing new features associated with Flutter and other related Google technologies.

We will watch the Flutter Interact keynote together (and possibly a couple of other sessions).

As the year's last event, it's a very laid-back event, focusing on getting to know each other and encouraging open discussions about Flutter and Dart (or anything that's on your mind).

For more information about Flutter Interact, visit: https://g.co/FlutterInteract

Agenda:
18:00-18:30 Watch Flutter Interact Keynote
18:30-18:45 Break
18:45-20:00 Dartpad Playthings Activity (codelab)
20:00-20:45 Networking
20:45-21:00 Wrap Up

We will have a codelab, please don't forget a laptop!

In case you would like to give a lightning talk, get in touch.

Note, this is not a "live" viewing party as the Flutter Interact conference takes place before this meetup on December 11th, 2019. Nonetheless, this viewing party is a great opportunity to view the keynotes together and discuss Flutter's future.

---

Join our Slack workspace to access LOTS of goodies (free webinars, online courses etc) and for the fastest communication with other members & organizers: http://bit.ly/GCDGNbgSlack

events.name: Online Self-Paced Workshop "Kubernetes in the Google Cloud"
events.description:
On 23-January-2020 at 6 PM we'll have our first ever ONLINE self-paced workshop (aka Cloud Study Jam) with the topic "Kubernetes in the Google Cloud". The workshop will take place in our Slack workspace, which you can join here: https://gdgcloudnbg.slack.com (first timers should use the link: http://bit.ly/GCDGNbgSlack ).

We'll use the Qwiklabs learning platform to complete the following
5 labs:

1. "Introduction to Docker" (regular time: 1 hour)
2. "Kubernetes Engine: Qwik Start" (regular time: 30 minutes)
3. "Orchestrating the Cloud with Kubernetes" (regular time: 1 hour 15 minutes)
4. "Managing Deployments Using Kubernetes Engine" (regular time: 1 hour)
5. "Continuous Delivery with Jenkins in Kubernetes Engine" (regular time: 1 hour 15 minutes)

The labs can be also completed after the online meetup. Everyone who completes all the 5 labs will unlock the "Kubernetes in the Google Cloud" badge. More details about the quest "Kubernetes in the Google Cloud" can be found at https://google.qwiklabs.com/quests/29

Every participant of the online meetup will be provided a FREE Qwiklabs code worth of $55, which will enable the access to the Qwiklabs learning platform for 1 month. After completion of any quest the free access will be prolonged by another 1 month.

Join the online workshop on 23-January-2020 at 6 PM using this link: https://gdgcloudnbg.slack.com (first timers should use the link: http://bit.ly/GCDGNbgSlack ).

events.name: Free Workshop "Get to Know Firebase for Web" (Firebase Study Jam)
events.description:
We are looking forward to seeing you at the Firebase Study Jam session at 18:00 on February 6th, 2020!

At the event we'll complete the codelab "Get to Know Firebase for Web" (http://bit.ly/get-to-know-firebase-for-web). For this reason we can use the google.dev (https://google.dev/topics/firebase) platform. Google.dev is optional and allows attendees to create a developer profile and save their progress within a codelab. If you have used google.dev before, great! Make sure you know your password. If you haven‚Äôt, save time by creating a new Google.dev account for yourself prior to the class (creating an account is free).

What to bring to the event:
- Laptop (Mac, PC, Chromebook, Linux, everyone‚Äôs welcome)
- Laptop charger

Looking forward to seeing you at the event!

Check out the impressions of our last Study Jam in November 2019: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L6TiT_HazgY&list=PLnqcFsZQcFPD42KjkxLy2kmUA40DTEhE0

events.name: ü§ù Coding competition Hash Code with START Erlangen-N√ºrnberg
events.description:
START Erlangen-N√ºrnberg e.V. of the University of Erlangen‚ÄìNuremberg will be hosting a hub at Nuremberg for the Online Qualification Round of Hash Code, a team programming competition organized by Google.

The Online Qualification Round takes place on February 20th, 2020 at 18:30 (local time) and registered teams are invited to participate from this hub. Exact Location will be determined soon. Top scoring teams from the Online Qualification Round will then be invited to Google‚Äôs office to compete in the Final Round of the competition in April.

WHERE:
University of Erlangen‚ÄìNuremberg (Lange Gasse 20, 90403 N√ºrnberg)
Room 0.141

If you‚Äôre interested in joining our hub, follow these steps:
1) sign up now at https://codingcompetitions.withgoogle.com/hashcode/
2) create a team
3) join START Nuremberg HUB at Friedrich Alexander University
4) ask friends to join your team
5) have a great competition on Feb. 20th 2020

Everyone, including students from other universities and non-students, are of course invited to join!

If you‚Äôre in search of a team or team members, don‚Äôt hesitate posing in this event or writing us a short message over Facebook. We will do our best to match you folks up!

The original event announcement can be found here: https://www.facebook.com/events/2688639977920781/

Our group members will be provided with FREE entry tickets to the expo and some useful advises how to survive and get most of this amazing event üòâ

To get a FREE 3-day ticket proceed to the following link: https://www.messe-ticket.de/Nuernberg/embeddedworld2020/Register/ew20Call

The list of all exhibitors and the floor plans are available at https://www.embedded-world.de/en/ You can also use the Embedded World app to navigate on site: https://www.embedded-world.de/en/exhibition-info/app There is also a free WiFi at the expo. If you plan to come by can then consider to park for free at the living area near Neptunweg, 90471 N√ºrnberg. Parking at the expo itself is not free.

Many companies at the expo are giving away free dev boards. In some cases you have to ask for them and describe the project/purpose you need this board for. Companies previously known to distribute the boards are: Mouser Electronics (missing this year), ST, Cypress, Arrow, DigiKey...

üé• Check out the video impressions of our other group trips: http://bit.ly/2RT7J3J

Join our Slack to chat with the organizers and other memebers: http://bit.ly/GCDGNbgSlack

events.name: Online Self-Paced Workshop "Security & Identity Fundamentals in Google Cloud"
events.description:
On 27-March-2020 at 6 PM we'll run an ONLINE self-paced workshop (aka Cloud Study Jam) on the topic "Security & Identity Fundamentals in the Google Cloud". The workshop will take place in our Slack workspace, which you can join here: https://gdgcloudnbg.slack.com (first timers should use the link: http://bit.ly/GCDGNbgSlack ).

We'll use the Qwiklabs learning platform to complete the quest consisting of the following 6 labs:

1. "Cloud IAM: Qwik Start"
2. "IAM Custom Roles" OR "Service Accounts and Roles: Fundamentals"
"Securing Google Cloud with CFT Scorecard"
3. "VPC Network Peering"
4. "User Authentication: Identity-Aware Proxy"
5. "Getting Started with Cloud KMS"
6. "Setting up a Private Kubernetes Cluster"

The labs can be also completed after the online meetup finishes. Everyone who completes all the 6 labs will unlock the "Security & Identity Fundamentals" badge. More details about the quest "Security & Identity Fundamentals" can be found at https://google.qwiklabs.com/quests/40

Every participant of the online meetup will be provided a FREE Qwiklabs code worth of $55, which will enable the access to the Qwiklabs learning platform for 1 month. After completion of any quest the free access will be prolonged by another 1 month.

Join the online workshop on 27-March-2020 at 6 PM using this link: https://gdgcloudnbg.slack.com (first timers should use the link: http://bit.ly/GCDGNbgSlack ).

Connect with us on Social Media üëç:
Twitter: https://twitter.com/GDGCloudNbg
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/gdgcloudnuremberg/
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/gdgcloudnuremberg/
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/gdg-cloud-nuremberg
YouTube: http://bit.ly/GDGCloudNbgYT

events.name: Women Techmakers Community Kick Off (IWD)
events.description:
We are inviting people of any gender to participate at our first ever initiation event (online) of the newly created Women Techmakers (WTM) group in Nuremberg! Together we'll celebrate this year's International Women's Day and discuss the main principles and goals of the group! Our very special guest and speaker at the event will be diversity expert Sonya Barlow from UK!

Agenda:
18:00-18:15 Welcome and introduction of participants
18:15-18:45 Speech by Sonya Barlow on diversity
18:45-19:10 Open discussion by all participants about diversity, own experiences, this group's organizational matter...
19:10-19:30 Discussion initiated by our member Dennise Cepeda about media portrayal of women in technology ‚ÄúMiss[tech] representation‚Äù (open end)

We are planning to record the whole session and share it later on our YouTube channel. If anyone doesn't want to be recorded, please let the organizers know it and we'll try our best to remove those parts.

We will use the open source video conferencing tool Jitsi.org that works the best in Chrome browser (will ask to install a plugin - please allow it). The link to the conference call is https://meet.jit.si/wtmnuremberg

Our speaker Sonya Barlow is the founder of LMF Network CiC, a global community dedicated to reducing inequalities and providing a foundation to succeed to women and underrepresented individuals through life skills workshops, digital training, a supportive community and access to expertise for everyone. She is also the founder of her own diversity consultancy and specializes in consulting on inclusive cultures, change management and confidence in the workplace. Sonya is valued for her public speaking skills, which includes delivering two TEDxTalks, facilitating workshops for the likes of General Assembly and delivering key notes across European conferences. Sonya has been recognised as a Rising Star (2017); UK Tech Business Woman of the Year Finalist (2018), Winner of Pitchfanzine (2019) and TechWomen200 finalist (2019). She is passionate about enabling inclusive cultures, educating on life skills and empowering confidence in all to achieve personal success. Her Ted talk is now on YouTube titled "Failures come before Resilience".
https://twitter.com/sonyabarlowuk
https://www.linkedin.com/in/sonyabarlow/

If you have any ideas about topics of the following meetups or want to speak at one, please reach out to the organizers. Any suggestions are very welcome!

Connect with WTM Nuremberg on social media:
https://twitter.com/WTMNuremberg
https://www.instagram.com/wtmnuremberg/
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLFctAbtoOGxjKcy1VWK42w
https://www.linkedin.com/company/women-techmakers-nuremberg/
https://www.facebook.com/Women-Techmakers-Nuremberg-100261568309291/

The Women Techmakers group in Nuremberg is hosted by GDG Cloud Nuremberg.

upcoming.name: Free Online Angular Workshop with Martina Kraus (in German)
upcoming.description:
*** IMPORTANT UPDATE! Unfortunately now all seats for the free Angular workshop on 11-April-2020 are gone. ***

Our group members and guests are invited to participate at a FREE online workshop to learn the one of the most popular JavaScript front-end frameworks - Angular! The workshop will be held in German by a Google Developer Expert Martina Kraus.

!!! IMPORTANT !!!! RSVP is not enough to participate at the workshop! Please, register using this form: https://forms.gle/WTdRWqoLFDKWQCJ76

Below is the description of the workshop provided by Martina:

---8<---
Du hast keine Ahnung von Web-Entwicklung? Oder du hast schon ein wenig Erfahrung gemacht aber w√ºrdest gerne mehr in die Angular Entwicklung einsteigen? Dann bist du hier richtig!

Dieser Workshop ist ein absoluter Einsteiger Workshop. Die Sprache ist hierbei deutsch :)

Ablauf:
10:00-11:30 Angular Block 1
11:30-11:45 eine kleine Pause :)
11:45-13:00 Angular Block 2
13:00-14:00 Uhr Mittagspause
14:00-15:30 Angular Block 3

Je nachdem wie m√ºde ihr seid, w√ºrde ich spontan noch einen vierten Block einsetzen :)
Auch die Pausen k√∂nnen wir zu Beginn sehr dynamisch absprechen :)

Ich freue mich auf euch!

Was ihr alles zu installieren habt (nicht viel keine Sorge)
werde ich dann allen Teilnehmern rechtzeitig zusenden :) )

Martina Kraus
Google Developer Expert in Angular and Web Technologies
---8<---

Join our Slack to chat with the organizers and other members: http://bit.ly/GCDGNbgSlack
